intro: Tertrea martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique trumpetweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
